perturbation.original_text: 1.23 "Open Free Web" means all websites (i) through which content can be indexed by Google and/or other consumer search engines; (ii) through which content is openly accessible by the public free of charge, and/or (iii) that do not charge a subscription fee or other fee for access to the content of the website.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.23 "Open Free Web" means all websites (i) through which content may or may not be indexed by Google and/or other consumer search engines; (ii) through which content is accessible at the website operator's discretion, and/or (iii) that may charge a subscription fee or other fee for access to specific premium content.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition of "Open Free Web" contradicts the standard understanding and common usage of the term, particularly regarding accessibility and indexing. By making indexing optional and allowing for subscription fees for 'premium content', it blurs the line between free and paid-access websites, creating uncertainty about the scope of licensed content for the 'Open Free Web'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract interpretation; potential misrepresentation under consumer protection laws if applied to end-users.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 (i) License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, World Book hereby grants to HSWI, a perpetual, irrevocable limited license to use, copy, store, archive, distribute, transmit, modify (subject to Section 2.1(iv)), and Display the Content, Images and Affinities in whole or in part, only on the HSWI Websites or in promotions in any media for the HSWI Websites.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 (i) License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, World Book hereby grants to HSWI, a license to use, copy, store, archive, distribute, transmit, modify (subject to Section 2.1(iv)), and Display the Content, Images and Affinities in whole or in part, only on the HSWI Websites or in promotions in any media for the HSWI Websites. This license is granted for a fixed, unspecified period.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the terms 'perpetual' and 'irrevocable' and adding "This license is granted for a fixed, unspecified period.", the nature and duration of the license become ambiguous. A license 'for a fixed, unspecified period' is inherently contradictory and unenforceable as it lacks a definite term, which is a fundamental requirement for a valid license agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic principles of contract law regarding definiteness of terms; intellectual property law regarding license duration.

perturbation.original_text: 11.6 Governing Law. This Agreement, the rights and obligations of the parties hereto, and any claims or disputes thereto, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without reference to conflict of law principles.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.6 Governing Law. This Agreement, the rights and obligations of the parties hereto, and any claims or disputes thereto, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the principles of natural justice, as determined by the arbitrator.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'the laws of the State of New York' with 'the principles of natural justice, as determined by the arbitrator' introduces a significant legal contradiction. 'Natural justice' is a philosophical concept, not a codified legal system. Giving the arbitrator sole discretion to define and apply these principles creates massive uncertainty and deviates from established legal standards. This undermines the predictability and enforceability of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic principles of contract law regarding choice of law; established legal precedent in New York State.
